intro: Pherosphaera fitzgeraldii, commonly known as the Fitzgerald's ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green, which appear in late summer. The plant has a short, thick stem and produces small, clustered leaves that are adapted to conserve water. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
